ANDS-Grants.description: The political staff system in Australia, established by the Member of Parliament Staff Act 1984, created a mechanism by which public servants can disengage from the public service while working as political staffers, and later re-engage in the public service. There is a blurring of the boundary between the political office and the neutral public service in the movement of personnel between the two institutions. This research explores the phenomenon of the ‘political public servant’ and the nature of impartiality and partisanship, asking whether these roles are easily adopted and discarded or whether in fact they coexist within a subset of ‘hybrid’ public servants.
